item.title: Japanese Charts: Sorry Samus, Octopath Is The Best-Selling New Release This Week
item.content:encoded:
Last week was a big one for new releases, and Famitsu is here to show how they all fared in their Japanese chart debut.

Somewhat surprisingly, nothing was able to topple the top four of Mario Kart World, Kirby Air Riders, and Pok√©mon Legends: Z-A (on Switch 1 and 2) this time. Less surprising is that Octopath Traveler 0 emerged as the best-selling newbie in fifth, outperforming Metroid Prime 4: Beyond on Switch 2, which debuted in sixth.

Remember, outside of Dread, Metroid has historically not sold well in Japan, so we're not entirely shocked to see Beyond appear so low. That said, after all these years of waiting, we would have thought the Switch 1 edition would at least make an appearance in the top 10...

The hardware charts have seen a big boom for Switch across the board. The Switch 2 shifted a whopping 200,000+ units last week, pushing its total up past the 3 million mark, and the Switch OLED and Lite models comfortably took second and third place.

Unsurprisingly, this means that combining the SKUs for the Switch and PS5 systems leans things firmly in Nintendo's favour. The standard, Lite and OLED models came together for 51,316, while the three PS5 options combined for 25,240.

item.title: Aethermancer‚Äôs latest update adds new monster Ravager
item.content:encoded:
Moi Rai Games has released a major quality of life update for roguelike monster battler RPG Aethermancer. This new update, which is update 0.5.0.8, adds the new monster Ravager, a Combat Inspect feature, and the ability to redistribute equipment among monsters. Ravager‚Äôs addition brings new moves and traits to use, so players can experiment with party builds some more. The Combat Inspect feature can be used at any time in battle so you can see exactly what buffs, debuffs, and conditions are active at any time. You can read the full patch notes below.

  • Festive Theme for Pilgrim‚Äôs Rest!
  • Added a new monster: Ravager!
    • Can be found in Pilgrimage Path as an alternative champion. Alternative champions unlock once you have beaten the regular champion at least once (Ravager is the only alternative champion for now). Once unlocked, you may encounter either the regular or alternative champion (it‚Äôs random).
    • Types: Terror, Critical, Dodge (Shifted: Terror, Critical, Sidekick)
    • Signature Trait: Cursed Blood: Aura: For every 10 Critical or Wild damage dealt by allies: Applies 1 Bleed to target enemy. (Unchanged for Shifted)

  • Added new skills to go with Ravager:

    • Lightning Assault (Critical Action) ‚Äì Fire/Fire/Wind/Wind: 4 x 4 damage against target enemy. +10% Crit Chance. On Crit: Applies 1 Bleed.
    • Splatter (Critical Trait): Aura: Allies gain +25% Crit Chance against enemies with Bleed. Whenever an enemy dies: Spreads half of their Bleed stacks to the remaining enemies.
    • Cunning Minions (Critical + Summon Maverick Trait): Minion Limit +1. **Aura: Each allied monster gains +10% Crit Chance and +1 Crit Damage for each Minion attached to it. (‚ÄùMinion Limit +1‚Äù is a new perk that increases the amount of Minions that can be attached to the monster by 1)
    • Dread and Gore (Critical + Terror Maverick Trait): Aura: Whenever Terror stacks are consumed on an enemy: Applies 1 Bleed for every 2 Terror stacks consumed. Whenever Bleed stacks are consumed on an enemy: Applies 1 Terror for every 2 Bleed stacks consumed.

  • Added a Combat Inspector!

    • You can now check what several things do even if you don‚Äôt want to use the Mouse!
    • You can now hover Actions, Equipment, Traits, Buff & Debuff‚Äôs, Perks and even the Reset Action of Enemies
    • This replaces the old Monster Info Screen

  • You can now redistribute old Equipment when replacing it with new Equipment

    • A small animation plays that communicates this

  • Start of every combat turn, the game now previews who the enemies are going to target

    • This can be disabled in settings
    • This also includes a Short Damage Preview of how much damage the enemy action would do without any additional modifiers like sidekick, etc. (You can check this damage preview again by hovering enemy actions)
  • You can click on the Monster overviews directly in the Pause Menu now to open their details page
  • The UI shows a yellow exclamation mark when a NPC offers new dialogue
  • Add Tooltip to Equipment Select Menu
  • Added a little memento icon for enemies in combat that you have not captured before
  • Added a new animation when unlocking secret rooms
  • Added the Inspect Monster Button to more NPC Events
  • Enemy Mephisto will now only use Alchemical Blast starting from turn 3 in combat
  • Added switch follower monster prompt & last rebirthed monster indicator to the Exploration HUD after rebirthing a monster
  • Resources are now displayed via the Exploration HUD in Pilgrim‚Äôs Rest
  • Added FPS Cap and VSync toggle setting
  • Reworked the visual presentation of Aether generation at the start of the turn
  • Most of the Music tracks got some of their instruments replaced by live recorded Instruments
    • 18 music tracks recorded by live instruments (Flute, Clarinet, Violin, & Nyckelharpa).
    • We‚Äôre eager to hear feedback how you like those changes!

Balancing Changes (Monster)

The balancing changes for this update are rather conservative, since the last set of balancing changes was rather recent. We mostly tried to target monsters, types, and skills that have been overperforming or underperforming for a long time.

Medusa

  • Adjusted the Signature Trait to trigger for every 5 debuffs cleansed (from 6) and deal 1 x 5 damage (from 1 x 6)

Naga

  • Adjusted the Signature Trait (unshifted) to deal 2 x 4 damage (instead of 2 x 2)
  • Increased 2nd Worthiness Perk (unshifted + shifted) to Shield Generator +3 (from +2)

Djinn

  • 3rd Worthiness perk (unshifted + shifted) increased to Evasion +20% (from 15%)
  • Shifted Djnn‚Äôs health reduced to 30 (from 35); matching the unshifted value
  • Signature Trait (unshifted) was adjusted to grant +35% Crit Chance (form +30% Crit Chance)

Balancing Changes (Types)

Critical

We decided to give a soft rework to the Critical type with this update. We removed the few skills that apply Force (instead moving them to the Force type). To make up for that, Critical now has easy access to skills that apply Bleed stacks. Bleed stacks open up more potential for synergies for the Critical type itself, as well as for Maverick skills with other types. We think this is a more interesting direction for the Critical type and also helps to distinguish the Critical type from the Force type. We also made some further buffs and reworked some non-aura skills into auras. Please also take note of the new skills we added to support this rework (listed above)!

  • Generate Force (Action): Only available to Force Type now.
  • Precision Meteor (Action): Only available to Force Type now.
  • Fire Blast (Action): Crit Chance increased to +30% (from +25%)
  • Stone Edge (Action): Damage reduced to 3 x 8 (from 3 x 9). Added: ‚ÄúOn Crit: Applies 1 Bleed.‚Äù
  • Critical Bleed (Maverick Trait): Changed into a regular Critical Trait (no longer requires Affliction type in the party, is no longer a Maverick Trait)
  • Cruelty (Trait): Reworked into a Force + Power Maverick Trait: ‚ÄúAt the start of combat, and whenever an enemy is staggered: Applies 1 Force and 2 temporary Power to self.‚Äù
    • Old effect (as a regular Critical Trait): ‚ÄúCrit Damage +3. At the start of combat, and whenever an enemy is staggered: Applies 1 Force to self.‚Äù
  • Critical Hybridization (Trait): Reworked into an aura: ‚ÄúAura: On Crit from an ally: Deals an extra hit with 3 Wild damage. Triggers once per action.‚Äù
    • Old effect: ‚ÄúOn Crit: Deals an extra hit with 3 Wild damage. Triggers once per action.‚Äù
  • Assault Shield (Maverick Trait): Reworked into an aura: ‚ÄúOn Crit from an ally: Shields them for 3.‚Äù
    • Old effect: ‚ÄúOn Crit: Applies 3 Shield to the ally with the lowest amount of Shield.‚Äù
  • Sidecrits (Maverick Trait): Now also applies 1 Bleed: ‚ÄúThis monster‚Äôs Sidekick Attack is always critical and applies 1 Bleed.‚Äù
    • Old effect: ‚ÄúThis monster‚Äôs Sidekick Attack is always critical.‚Äù

Force

Apart from the Critical rework, the most drastic set of changes are aimed at the Force type, which has been underperforming for a long time. These changes are meant to help promote the intended Force strategy of using Support Actions to build up Force stacks.

  • Petal Shield (Action): Force stacks applied increased to 2 (from 1)
  • Air Shield (Action): Force stacks applied increased to 3 (from 2), but Shielding per Force stack reduced to 2 (from 3)
  • Precision Meteor (Action): Damage increased to 1 x 18 (from 1 x 15)
  • Into the Fray (Trait): Adjusted to apply 1 Force to each ally (instead of applying 1 Force to target ally and 1 Force to self)
  • Reinforce (Trait): Reduced the healing to 3 (from 5) and increased the Force applied to 2 (from 1)
  • Fierce Summoning (Maverick Trait): Also Shields the attached monster for 3 when it triggers
  • Massive Damage (Maverick Trait): Health required per +1 Crit Damage adjusted to 15 (from 20)

Burn

  • ‚ÄúBurn Hit‚Äù equipment affixes were buffed: regular affix was buffed to +12% (from +10%) and rare affix was buffed to +20% (from +15%)

Terror

  • Bone Chill (Action): Terror stacks applied increased to 5 (from 4)
  • Panic (Trait): Terror stacks applied increased to 6 (from 5)
  • Nighmare (Trait): The damage hits now ignore retaliates
  • Dark Exchange (Maverick Trait): Debuffs cleansed (and transferred) increased to 4 (from 3)
  • Frightful Lightning: Applies 3 Terror to each enemy (instead of 3 Terror to each other enemy)

Summon

  • New equipment affix: ‚ÄúEssence Summoning +1‚Äù (Minions summoned by this monster gain +1 Essence). Requires ‚ÄúSummon‚Äù type in the party to be obtained.
  • Protective Servitude (Trait): Increased healing and shielding to 6 (from 5)
  • Summon Mastery (Trait): Increased Minion Damage to +2 (from +1). Removed the aura tag.
  • Impactful Summoning (Trait): Increased the damage to 4 (from 3)
  • Totem Summons: Changed to apply 4 heal + 4 shield (instead of only doing 6 shield)
  • Faun: Heal changed to 2 x 3 (from 3x 2) (This was always meant to be 2 x 3, but was set up wrongly)

Purge

  • Shock (Trait): Damage reduced to 6 (from 7)
  • Split Aether (Maverick Trait): Damage reduced to 6 (from 7)
  • Wildflower Harvest (Maverick Action): Damage reduced to 3 x 4 (from 3 x 5)

Weakness

  • Hexing Strikes (Trait): No longer has Weakness Reduction +1
  • Warlock Party (Trait): Now also has Weakness Reduction +1, but only applies 1 Weakness to the enemy with the lowest amount of Weakness (instead of 2 Weakness distributed to up to 2 enemies with the lowest amount of Weakness)

Dodge

  • Eye of the Storm: Required damage adjusted to 35 (from 30)

Bug Fixes

  • Quicken now triggers properly for big heal numbers
  • Fix Aether Display Animation in Combat being offset
  • Fixed getting the same map generation seed when forfeiting and restarting a run sometimes
  • Fixed players being able to activate the third Aether Spring before Garden District
  • Fixed some small localization related issues
  • Fixed possible softlock on level up skill selection (possible to encounter with shifted Serket)
  • Fixed Npc music being a bit too quiet
  • Fixed Player Monster HUD‚Äôs not resetting between fights
  • Fixed an issue where the secret rooms wouldn‚Äôt properly unlock when you load into a zone where the secret room is already unlocked
  • Fixed Chernobog Action Display being wrong with less then two actions if the remaining action was stemming from an Arm
  • Fixed Chernobog using player actions which were no longer blocked by the arms
  • Toxic sprawl no longer loses track of consumed regeneration stacks when allies die
  • Fixed Inspect in Starter Shrine Selection selecting wrong Monster if the Random Monster Button was displayed
  • Fixed being able to double soul catch the same monster if it already guaranteed for the next Shrine
  • Fixed Control the Cursed Description for Chernobog
  • Fixed Terror Wild Element applying to wrong monsters when attacking enemies with a mass action that had Terror
  • Fixed Temporary Boons disappearing when loading save file where combats were won
  • Fixed Chernobog not appearing in his Introduction Cutscene
  • Fixed asset layering in Pilgrim‚Äôs Rest
  • Fixed missing lower wall sprites in Garden District in special cases
  • Fixed Garden Protector layering
  • Fixed too strong wind in Pilgrimage Path
  • Fixed too many Samebito The Wise pictures generating in FF
  • Fixed not being able to change the difficulty with the Mouse properly
  • Fixed Start Run Button Description in Pause Menu

Source: Steam



https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/12/11/aethermancers-latest-update-adds-new-monster-ravager/

item.title: You Won‚Äôt Believe How Cheap It Was To Make Clair Obscur: Expedition 33
item.content:encoded:
Much has been said about Clair Obscur: Expedition 33‚Äôs success and the business calls that made it an unexpected frontrunner in the 2025 Game of the Year race. Now we‚Äôve learned that the game was somehow made for less than $10 million. 

In an interview with The New York Times, Sandfall Interactive co-founder and CEO Guillaume Broche said that Clair Obscur: Expedition 33‚Äôs budget was a tiny fraction of your average AAA game, coming out to ‚Äúless than $10 million.‚Äù To put that into perspective, Insomniac‚Äôs Spider-Man 2 cost around $300 million. Clair Obscur managed to avoid those ballooning budgets by aiming for a much smaller scale and refusing to chase the modern open-world bloat that has some games costing huge fortunes and taking half a decade to make.

As Broche lays out, Sandfall made a string of creative decisions that would allow the studio to create a lot with fewer resources, a smaller team, and a reasonable budget. One major example is how the game‚Äôs overworld is a miniature recreation of a map, rather than a full-blown open-world space. This allowed the devs to present an explorable universe to players without having to create something on the scale of open-world games that show off every detail as players walk through it.

Sandfall is an independent studio, but much of Clair Obscur‚Äòs funding came from publisher Kepler Interactive, and some parts of development (including battle animations and localization) were outsourced. The result is that Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 manages to have all the polish of a prestige AAA game at a budget that a lot of other publishers would have you believe can‚Äôt possibly produce games of its quality. 

There‚Äôs still a false narrative floating around the internet that only 30 people made Sandfall Interactive‚Äôs breakout debut RPG. While yes, the company itself may be smaller than your average studio, Clair Obscur was also developed in collaboration with contractors. The numbers don‚Äôt lie, though. When blockbuster development costs are ballooning, Clair Obscur proves you can make a hit that still looks and feels impressive without breaking the bank.

It also, thankfully, is not a massive time sink. I rolled credits at around 30 hours, while most RPGs last at least twice as long. Broche told The New York Times he hopes Clair Obscur‚Äòs success will help bring the cost of developing AAA games back to a more reasonable range.

‚ÄúWe have the tech now to make those games with a relatively small team,‚Äù Broche said. ‚ÄúGames like this are coming. We are lucky to be early.‚Äù

The 2025 Game Awards are tonight, and Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 has 13 nominations across multiple categories, which is the most any game has earned in the event‚Äôs decade-long history.



https://kotaku.com/clair-obscur-expedition-33-budget-cost-goty-sandfall-2000652590

item.title: Samsung MicroSD Card Returns at $0.07 per GB, Expand Storage on Nintendo Switch, Phones, or Tablets for Almost Nothing
item.content:encoded:
Storage has become one of the most frustrating limitations of modern tech. No matter how much space manufacturers promise, it never feels like enough. Our phones eventually fill up with new photos and videos, our PCs balloon with game downloads and media files, and our gaming consoles never seem to have enough room for the next title we want to install. Because of this ongoing struggle, storage deals tend to be some of the best and most reliable purchases you can make. When SSDs, external drives, or microSD cards go on sale, it‚Äôs usually smart to grab one. Right now, the Samsung EVO Select line of memory cards is discounted by as much as 25%, making it a great time to upgrade your device‚Äôs storage without spending much.

Amazon has a handful of options at various capacities all on sale at the moment. The 64GB version of the Samsung EVO Select microSD is only  $15 at the moment. But what‚Äôs this? So is the 128GB version. You can double the storage for no extra charge. Beyond that, the 256GB version is down to $23, and the full 1TB option has dropped from $93 to just $70.

See at Amazon

Download More Game to Your Nintendo Switch

For gamers in particular, especially those who own a Nintendo Switch, a microSD card is practically a necessity. The original Nintendo Switch model launched with only 32GB of internal storage, which disappears remarkably fast once you start downloading games. While Nintendo titles tend to be smaller than the enormous triple-A games common on PlayStation, Xbox, and PC‚Äîmany of which exceed 100GB‚ÄîSwitch games can still add up quickly. For instance, The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom weighs in at around 18.2GB, which is more than half of the system‚Äôs default storage all by itself. Add a couple more games and your space is gone in an instant.

That‚Äôs why ya gotta upgrade. With the Samsung EVO Select 1TB MicroSD card currently available for just $70, you can multiply your Switch storage many, many times over without needing to delete and redownload your favorite titles. 1TB gives you enough room to store a massive library of games, screenshots, captures, and save data, ensuring you‚Äôll never need to stress about running out of space before a big download ever again.

However, if you‚Äôre playing on the Nintendo Switch 2, I hate to be the bearer of bad news. These particular microSD cards will not work with the latest Nintendo console. Nintendo‚Äôs next-generation console uses the newer microSD Express format, which offers significantly faster read and write speeds. Because of this difference, inserting a Samsung EVO Select MicroSD card into a Switch 2 will be met with nothing but an incompatibility message. Or maybe just nothing at all, I haven‚Äôt personally tested it.

The good news is that the EVO Select cards remain fully functional with the former lineup of Nintendo systems: the original Nintendo Switch, the Switch Lite, and the Switch OLED model.

In terms of performance, the Samsung EVO Select series delivers read and write speeds up to 160MB/s. While that doesn‚Äôt meet the more demanding requirements of the Switch 2, it exceeds what‚Äôs needed for the original Switch family, which only recommends speeds up to 90MB/s. In practical terms, this means smooth loading times and reliable performance for everything you play. Unless you‚Äôre playing a Pok√©mon game because nothing can help those perform well.

See at Amazon

item.title: PC RAM Now Costs More Than Some New Graphics Cards
item.content:encoded:
The PC Ram pricing problem continues to get worse for consumers. What was once one of the cheaper parts when building a custom PC, buying RAM has gotten to the point where it‚Äôs more expensive than buying even a brand-new graphics card for some.

A few weeks back, Insider Gaming reported on the fact that RAM prices have risen by up to 250%. Well, fast forward to mid-December, and those prices now look ‚Äúaffordable‚Äù. There have been increases in PC RAM prices by, on average, another 25% since November 26. Some have even gone up by another 50% or more if you were looking at picking up a 64GB pack.

That means modern day graphics cards like the Nvidia GeForce RTX 50 series and AMD Radeon RX 9000 series are becoming cheaper in comparison. Need specific examples? A new ASUS Prime GeForce RTX 5070 is available for $549.99 while a ASRock Radeon RX 9070 XT can be had for $599.99. Even an RTX 5070 Ti, which costs an average of $749.99, is cheaper than some 64GB packs, like the Corsair Vengeance.

Below you‚Äôll find a comparison of prices from November 1 to November 26 to December 11. All of them have continued to rise, with reports suggesting that it‚Äôs not going to slow down. It‚Äôs even gotten to the point that traditional budget-friendly brands are being completely shuttered in order to focus on the needs of the big AI companies that are causing the problems.

Insider Gaming has attempted to reach out to multiple manufacturers to discuss what consumers can do and if they are going to do anything to make sure they still have options when building a PC. As of publishing, however, no company has given answers.

What do you think of the current state of consumer PC part prices, and when do you feel things could get better? Leave your thoughts down below and join the discussion in the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming, read about the United Kingdom‚Äôs Prime Minister saying that Rockstar will be investigated for potential union busting. And don‚Äôt forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

Real-time news, exclusive podcasts, push alerts, and a better reading experience.

item.title: Genshin Impact-Themed PS5 DualSense Controller Is Up for Preorder
item.content:encoded:
Out February 25.

Anyone looking to add some pizazz to their gaming setup doesn‚Äôt have to look far to find ways to do so. One of the best ways is to pick up a special edition controller. And fans of Genshin Impact can now preorder the great-looking PS5 DualSense Wireless Controller ‚Äì Genshin Impact Limited Edition (see it on Amazon). It costs $84.99 and is set to release on February 25 in the U.S.

DualSense Wireless Controller - Genshin Impact Limited Edition

DualSense Wireless Controller - Genshin Impact Limited Edition

  • Get it at Amazon
  • Get it at Best Buy
  • Get it at GameStop
  • Get it at PS Direct

The new controller is coming in part to promote the recent release of Genshin Impact Version Luna III, ‚Äúwhich features the new playable character Durin and fresh updates to the story in Nod-Krai.‚Äù Click the above link for full details about the update and patch notes.

As for the controller itself, Sony said in a blog post that its designers worked closely with HoYoverse to create the design. It features ‚Äúdesign elements inspired by Genshin Impact‚Äôs beloved Traveler Twins and Paimon, celebrating years of adventure and companionship in Teyvat.‚Äù It has a white and gorgeous blue color scheme, with gold and blue etchings on the grips, touch pad, and D-pad. The face buttons also feature gold versions of the traditional PlayStation shapes.

PS5 DualSense Controller - Genshin Impact Limited Edition

Functionally, it will be identical to all other PS5 DualSense controllers. It has haptic feedback for vibrations, adaptive triggers that can put resistance on your pulls. It has a built in microphone and speaker, and the built-in battery can be charged via its USB-C port. It‚Äôs compatible with PS5, PC, Mac, and mobile devices.

Sony says, ‚ÄúSelect markets across Asia, including Japan‚Äù will get the controller on January 21. Those in the rest of the world, including the U.S., will have to wait about a month as it releases on February 25 in those regions.

If you‚Äôd rather get a new PS5 controller sooner (in time for Christmas, perhaps), you can check out our running list of every PS5 controller available. You have plenty of colorful and fun designs to choose from.

Chris Reed is a commerce editor and deals expert for IGN. He also runs IGN's board game and LEGO coverage. You can follow him on Bluesky.

item.title: You'll Soon Be Able to Buy Kim Kardashian in Fortnite ‚Äî Here's How She Looks
item.content:encoded:
Kim Kardashian is joining Fortnite, and you'll be able to play as the TV and fashion icon beginning this weekend.

Two Kim Kardashian skins will become available in Fortnite this Saturday, December 13, cementing the star as one of the game's highest-profile public figures to date.

Leaning into the Kardashian's fashionable status, Kim's skins have been designed to be highly customisable. The Iconic Kim Kardashian skin features her in skin-tight attire with alterable colors, necklines and hairstyles. The regular Kim Kardashian skin, meanwhile, comes with a jacket you can toggle on and off.

Accompanying these are a pair of emotes, including one where Kim shakes up a bottle of Slurp juice and uncorks it over her head, catching it in a glass balanced on her... foot. (Fortnite might have nipples now, but squirting into a glass on your behind is apparently the limit.)

Kardashian's appearance in Fortnite is tied extremely loosely into the game's recent Chapter 7 relaunch. Its main battle royale modes now feature a fresh Californian-inspired map with the game's own version of Hollywood to explore.

The latest addition to Fortnite's Icon Series of real-life stars, Kardashian joins fellow luminaries such as Snoop Dogg, Ariana Grande, Lady Gaga, Billy Eilish, Eminem, and England soccer player Harry Kane. Now that's a squad.

Tom Phillips is IGN's News Editor. You can reach Tom at tom_phillips@ign.com or find him on Bluesky @tomphillipseg.bsky.social

item.title: Pok√©mon TCG Pocket's next booster pack revealed, with fan-favourite Mega Evolutions
item.content:encoded:
Crimson Blaze out this month.

The next booster pack coming to Pok√©mon TCG Pocket has been revealed, called Crimson Blaze.

Available from 17th December, it will features fan-favourite Mega Evolutions such as Mega Charizard Y, Mega Venusaur, and Mega Blastoise.

There are plenty more new cards too, with a research lab theme. You can check out more in the trailer below.

Mega Evolutions are having a moment elsewhere in Pok√©mon too, thanks to their inclusion in Pok√©mon Legends: Z-A. Its DLC arrived yesterday, bringing spatial distortions to Lumiose City, on top of Mewtwo's recent appearance in the base game.

As you'd expect, Pok√©mon TCG Pocket has a holiday-themed event starting on Christmas Day and running until 8th January, with various seasonal awards.

In addition, January will see a Mareep Drop Event, a fresh Wonder Pick Event, and a Mega Latios ex Drop Event.

item.title: A New Tomb Raider Entry Has Leaked Ahead Of The Game Awards
item.content:encoded:
But is it a remake..?

The Game Awards is taking place later today (or early tomorrow depending on your timezone), but it seems that yet another major announcement has leaked ahead of schedule.

As reported by Eurogamer, the cover art for a new Tomb Raider entry has cropped up online along with a handful of screenshots. Titled Tomb Raider: Legacy of Atlantis, some are speculating that it might actually be (another) remake of the original game from 1996, which itself also dealt with Atlantis.

The cover art features an updated iteration of Lara Croft which seems to blend the original design with the more realistic take featured in the 2013 reboot (which, by the way, recently saw a release on Switch and Switch 2).

So if this is all legit ‚Äì and it certainly seems to be ‚Äì is it possible that this new entry could come to the Switch 2? It's hard to say at this stage, but it's a definite possibility. There's been a smattering of Tomb Raider titles on the Switch and Switch 2 in recent years, with the aforementioned Definitive Edition preceded by Tomb Raider IV-VI Remastered and Tomb Raider I-III Remastered from Aspyr.

Remake or not, the screenshots certainly look pretty neat, so we'll have to wait until The Game Awards to see this thing in action. Resident Evil Requiem is also due to receive a fresh new trailer at the event, but a new piece of key art from the PSN store prematurely revealed the existence of veteran protagonist Leon Kennedy.

Would you like to see a brand-new Tomb Raider game on the Switch 2? Leave a comment in the usual place and let us know.

[source x.com, via x.com, eurogamer.net]

Nintendo Life‚Äôs resident horror fanatic, when he‚Äôs not knee-deep in Resident Evil and Silent Hill lore, Ollie likes to dive into a good horror book while nursing a lovely cup of tea. He also enjoys long walks and listens to everything from TOOL to Chuck Berry.

item.title: Monster Hunter Stories (1 and 2), Death Howl, Skate Story and More Join NVIDIA GeForce NOW This Week
item.content:encoded:
Today might be all about The Game Awards, but it's still another Thursday in a new week, which means another NVIDIA GeForce NOW Thursday is here, with a new batch of games added to NVIDIA's cloud streaming service. This week, seven titles enter the service for the first time, including two games from one franchise, and three games are added to the selection of titles that are RTX 5080-ready.

The two games from one franchise are Monster Hunter Stories and Monster Hunter Stories 2: Wings of Ruin. Ahead of Monster Hunter Stories 3: Twisted Reflection arriving on March 13, 2026, you'll now be able to play through the first two games using GeForce NOW.

Two other notable games joining the service this week are two new releases, Skate Story and Death Howl, both two of the more interesting indie games to arrive towards the end of the year.

Here's the full list of games joining GeForce NOW for the first time this week:

  • Skate Story (December 8)
  • Dome Keeper (December 9)
  • Death Howl (December 9)
  • RuneQuest: Warlords (December 9)
  • Everdream Village (December 12)
  • Monster Hunter Stories
  • Monster Hunter Stories 2: Wings of Ruin

As far as the three games that are now RTX 5080-ready, it's a good week for 4X strategy players and city-sim building players, with the three games being Age of Wonders 4, Cities: Skylines, and Cities: Skylines 2.

Speaking of the RTX 5080 Blackwell servers, they are still one region short of being available worldwide, according to the map of their initial rollout. Stockholm has yet to be added, though it is expected to join the rest of the regions where RTX 5080 servers are already available "soon."

Lastly, a final mention for The Game Awards, you can play a majority of the nominated games through GeForce NOW, including the heavyweight favourite, Clair Obscur: Expedition 33, and the games that have a shot at stealing GOTY out from its grasp, like Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 and Hollow Knight Silksong.

For more on The Game Awards, you can check out our TGA 2025 hub for all of our coverage on the show and to see what announcements will be there and/or are heavily rumoured to appear.

Follow Wccftech on Google to get more of our news coverage in your feeds.

item.title: The kid-friendly console that outsold Xbox during Black Friday is $50 off
item.content:encoded:
Cameron Faulkner

is an editor covering deals and gaming hardware. He joined in 2018, and after a two-year stint at Polygon, he rejoined The Verge in May 2025.

The Nex Playground is a motion-controlled, cube-shaped console for ages five and up that‚Äôs selling like hotcakes. It came in third for home console sales during Black Friday week, according to sales data shared on Bluesky from Mat Piscatella of Circana, falling behind only Nintendo‚Äôs Switch 2 and Sony‚Äôs PlayStation 5. That‚Äôs an impressive feat for Nex, and not a great look for Microsoft‚Äôs Xbox consoles, which saw two price hikes this year.

If you missed your chance to pick one up at its 20 percent off sale price, you can do so now through December 14th. Best Buy and Walmart are selling it for $199.99.

$199

What if the dream of Microsoft‚Äôs Kinect lived on? It does in the Nex Playground, an all-in-one, motion-controlled console filled with kid-friendly games. Exhaust and entertain your little ones. You‚Äôre welcome.

The Nex Playground includes the console itself, a remote for navigating its menus, a power supply and HDMI cable, as well as a magnetic privacy cover that snaps onto the Playground‚Äôs camera lens. There are a ton of games that you can download to the Playground ‚Äî all of which are controlled by moving your body ‚Äî although the console comes with just five to get you started (Fruit Ninja, Starri, Party Fowl, Go Keeper, and Whack-a-Mole Deluxe are all pretty fun).

If you want more, including a bunch of licensed games involving Elmo, Bluey, Care Bears, How to Train Your Dragon, Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, Peppa Pig, you‚Äôll need a Play Pass to access them. New games are added to the catalog every season, and are automatically downloaded to your Playground.

item.title: Sony Goes Into Full Clearance Mode on Its Soundbar as the S100F With Bass Reflex Speaker Hits an All-Time Low
item.content:encoded:
You can‚Äôt really enjoy an immersive viewing experience without great sound to match the visuals. If you‚Äôre looking to make holiday movie nights better but your current TV doesn‚Äôt have solid built-in speakers, adding a soundbar to the setup can be a smart move. And thanks to Amazon, picking one up doesn‚Äôt break the bank today.

The Sony S100F 2.0ch soundbar is currently going for just $98 at Amazon, after the retailer took a whopping 39% off its usual price of $160. Shipping is free as well, so you‚Äôre not adding anything on top of the sale price. Even better, orders placed today will arrive before Christmas, so you can have fun streaming marathons with friends and family with fuller, richer audio that fills the room. Note that it‚Äôs only around for a short time, so it‚Äôs best to grab yours before the offer expires.

See at Amazon

Surround Sound Experience

The slim design blends into every entertainment setup well, matching the aesthetics of any room. You can place it on your console right below the screen, or mount it on the wall if you prefer a cleaner setup. It punches well above its weight, though. Sony has packed the soundbar with a two-speaker setup that delivers front surround sound by handling the full audio range without requiring additional subwoofers or speakers. It produces audio as a stereo mix for a wider soundstage that fills the entire room, instead of just blasting from the front.

The bass reflex speaker does an incredible job of delivering punchy, deep bass without compromising on the details, even when you have pumped the volume all the way up. You will be able to vibe to all your favorite tunes, plus immerse yourself in thrilling scenes like never before. S-Force Pro, on the other hand, emulates cinema-style sound fields for better clarity and a 3D experience. Translation? Cars in F1 race past your couch, gunfire erupts right in your living room, and the Grinch‚Äôs footsteps feel like they‚Äôre actually coming from behind you. Whether you‚Äôre planning to watch an action-packed series or stream some good old Christmas title, it makes you feel a part of what‚Äôs happening on the screen.

There‚Äôs a voice enhancement feature that automatically improves dialog clarity, even in those loud, chaotic scenes. It also comes in handy when you‚Äôre catching up with friends on a bigger screen; you will be able to hear everyone on the conference call clearly. Connectivity couldn‚Äôt be easier. A single HDMI ARC connection between the TV and the soundbar gets the party started. You can control both the TV and the soundbar with a single remote. Best of all, it supports Bluetooth connections just as well, which is great for when you want to pair your smartphone wirelessly with it. Maybe play some songs or a podcast in the background as you set holiday decorations up!

On a regular day, this speaker would run you around $160, but this deal lets you grab it for $98, which is quite affordable considering all the features it gets you. If you‚Äôve been after better sound, this soundbar can be an excellent addition to your setup. Snap it up quick, though, as the discount is a limited-time one. The retailer hasn‚Äôt specified an end date, but we‚Äôre not expecting it to last long. Placing your orders now will also allow you to get it before Christmas!

See at Amazon

item.title: This ARC Raiders Backpack Has Single-Handedly Crashed the NVIDIA Website
item.content:encoded:
ARC Raiders is a beloved game after being on the market for a little more than six weeks. It‚Äôs an all-new extraction adventure title from Embark Studios, and it‚Äôs proving to be a true disruptor to the genre. Recently, NVIDIA kickstarted a promotional event that allows certain players to unlock an exclusive ARC Raiders backpack, and it has proven to be a little too popular.

If you try to redeem the ARC Raiders NVIDIA backpack right now, you‚Äôll be met with network errors and server issues.

The NVIDIA ARC Raiders Backpack is Sought-After

There are a few caveats to claiming the ARC Raiders NVIDIA backpack, the most critical of which is that you need to be a PC gamer with an NVIDIA GPU. This is because it needs to link to the NVIDIA App and the GeForce Rewards program.

We‚Äôve got a full guide explaining how to get the ARC Raiders backpack from NVIDIA.

The listing went live at 6 AM PT, and what must be thousands of ARC Raiders fans were waiting to receive it, so much so that the NVIDIA site stopped working:

This is a testament to the power of ARC Raiders, which is one of the most popular and successful games of 2025 after just a few weeks on the market.

To be honest, customization in ARC Raiders could be a little better. It‚Äôs limited right now, and that‚Äôs fine, because it‚Äôs a live-service game and Embark Studios is adding more content as they flesh out the holistic offering. But that‚Äôs why deals like this NVIDIA ARC Raiders backpack are so special ‚Äì because people want more ways to outfit their character.

Let us know on the Insider Gaming Discord server if you managed to secure one of the NVIDIA backpacks in ARC Raiders.

item.title: Fort Solis coming to Xbox Series on December 19
item.content:encoded:
• Xbox Series

Currently available for PlayStation 5 and PC.

Publishers Feardemic and Dear Villagers, and developers Fallen Leaf and Black Drakkar Games will release open-ended, interactive science-fiction adventure game Fort Solis for Xbox Series via Microsoft Store on December 19, the companies announced.

Fort Solis first launched for PlayStation 5 and PC via Steam on August 22, 2023.

Here is an overview of the game, via Feardemic:

About

Responding to an unusual emergency call from a remote mining base, Jack arrives at the dark and desolate Fort Solis. With storm warnings imminent, he heads inside to make desperate contact.

As the night grows longer, events spiral out of control, and the mystery of what happened to the crew begins to reveal itself. The storm is approaching, limiting Jack‚Äôs escape as he looks to hold out until morning arrives.

Key Features

  • Immersive Storytelling ‚Äì Experience the long night alongside the cast through carefully crafted audio and video logs,
  • Visuals Out of This World ‚Äì A blend of rich details and captivating facial and body animation makes the universe of Fort Solis feel truly alive,
  • The Voices of the Storm ‚Äì Performances from Roger Clark, Troy Baker and Julia Brown deliver emotion with every chapter,
  • Four Chapters, One Story ‚Äì Binge the game in one intense session or enjoy it chapter by chapter, like an episodic TV show.

Watch a new trailer below.

Xbox Series Announce Trailer

item.title: Skyrim's Many Re-Releases Have Become "A Bit Of A Joke," Dev Says
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Bethesda's RPG The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim has been released on so many platforms over the years since its 2011 debut that one developer at Bethesda believes it's becoming something of a joke.

Bethesda's Matt Carofano, the creative director for the just-released Switch 2 Anniversary Edition of Skyrim, told Nintendo Life that, "It's a bit of a joke at this point how often we release Skyrim."

Want us to remember this setting for all your devices?

Sign up or Sign in now!

Please use a html5 video capable browser to watch videos.

This video has an invalid file format.

Sorry, but you can't access this content!

Now Playing: Skyrim Made Dominic Monaghan's PS3 EXPLODE | Star Players

Carofano said Skyrim is a "great game" and the goal in releasing the game in so many places is to help it reach more people "in the best way possible."

He also discussed bringing Skyrim to Switch 2, saying there is a "whole new generation" of people who might pick up a Switch 2 and "that's the first time they've ever played Skyrim."

Bethesda previously put Skyrim on the original Switch, so creating a native Switch 2 version was "really an easy development process" and a "pretty quick" job to do, at least compared to Bethesda's traditional development timelines.

"Making the game takes years and years and years, but bringing it to this new console was a much, much faster process," he said.

The developer went on to discuss the ways in which Bethesda took advantage of the Switch 2 hardware.

"A lot of it was really just focusing on taking advantage of the new hardware. We can use DLSS now and get better resolution, better performance, and the game loads faster," he said. "Switch 2 has the Joy-Con 2 controllers that let you use mouse controls, so we added that. A lot of it is really just, 'How do we take advantage of the Switch 2? What can it do? And [how can we] give players the best version of Skyrim for that console?'"

Skyrim for Switch 2 launched this week and people quickly discovered numerous issues, including input delay. Bethesda said it is now investigating reports of performance issues, but there is no timeline or further details for when fixes will be available.

Before this, Bethesda boss Todd Howard joked about all the re-releases for Skyrim. He said, "If you want us to stop releasing it, stop buying it." Skyrim was originally released in 2011 for PS3, Xbox 360, and PC, before coming to PS4 and Xbox One in 2016, then Nintendo Switch in 2017, and then PS5 and Xbox Series X|S in 2021. The Switch 2 edition launched on December 9.

For those who already own the Anniversary Edition on the original Switch, the Switch 2 upgrade for Skyrim is available for free. Those who don't already own any version of Skyrim on Switch can buy it on Switch 2 for $60. Owners of the non-Anniversary Edition of Skyrim on Switch can upgrade to the Anniversary Edition for $20 and then receive the Switch 2 version for free. The Anniversary Edition includes the base game and its three official expansions, as well as access to Creation Club content made by players.

Skyrim has sold more than 60 million copies and ranks as one of the top 10 best-selling games of all time. Its enduring appeal even surprised Skyrim's lead designer, who recently said he expected some other game to eclipse it in the years following its release. Part of the game's enduring popularity comes from Skyrim's vibrant mod scene, where players are always creating new content that can transform the world Bethesda created in surprising ways.

Bethesda is currently working on Skyrim's sequel, The Elder Scrolls VI, which was announced in 2018 but does not have a release date. In November, Howard said the highly anticipated RPG is "still a long way off" and that he's "preaching patience" to fans. Howard has previously said he wonders if it was a mistake to announce Elder Scrolls VI so early.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: 007 First Light leak reveals that its villain wants to flyyyyyyy awayyyyyyy just like a dragonfly
item.content:encoded:
I wish that I could fly, that I could fly, and I could fly, just like a dragonfly, Mr Bond. I want to get away, just like a dragonfly, Mr Bond. YEAH YEAH YEAH, Mr Bond. I want a Milky Way, Mr Bond. I'd just like a Milky Way, YEAH YEAH YEAH (Milky Way), Mr Bond. Oh, and the official James Bond account appears to have leaked a trailer showing Lenny Kravitz as a007: First Light, villain, Mr Bond.

The video above isn't the trailer the 007 Twitter account shared and the yanked earlier today, as spotted by users on ResetEra. It is, however, the first thing which comes to mind when I think of musician Lenny Kravitz, whom the trailer shows lending his face to a First Light villain named Bawma.

Bawma, according to the text of the tweet that's handily been screenshotted by the Ian Games Network, "rose from nothing, broke free, and built his own Kingdom of Aleph." He's "the largest black-market dealer in the Western Hemisphere who's as charismatic as he is unpredictable."

Bawma shows off this charismatic unpredictability in the trailer by threatening to drop Bond into a pit of female crocodiles. Bond, always thinking with his tadger, ends the trailer by saying "Girls? Of course." Like he's just figured out his life's a big cosmic knob joke. A cosmic knob joke that'll presumably be laughed at again at tonight's Geoff Awards, assuming IO Interactive debut this trailer properly there.

Anyway, shout out to Neil Cicierega for absolutely ruining a bunch of songs for me in the best way possible. Make sure you're bustin into our Geoff Awards liveblog today if you fancy watching the show alongside us.

item.title: Total War: Warhammer 40,000 reveal likely after telltale word "40K" spotted in Creative Assembly video
item.content:encoded:
Well, well, well, here comes Geoffers. G-Kay, the awarder of golden PDF badges to videogames, best pal to every celebrity less tasteful than Edward Norton. Gentleman Keighley, with his mindflaying footwear and his hands all lubed up to wangle fresh announcements from the games industry's chapped orifices. But what's this! His trousers are bellowing. He's got something stuffed down them, something that honks and rumbles like an elephant seal, something that yearns to raise the banner of victory over 10 million planets.

Geoff grabs his groin and waddles away desperately, but not fast enough. His backside explodes in a rank gust of Promethium. A terrifying cybernetic face peers from the breach. "FOR THE EMPEROR," it hollers, while Geoff frantically seeks cover behind Evanescense. "FOR THE EMPEROR, PROBABLY! BUT MAYBE ACTUALLY FOR THE REBELLION INSTEAD."

All of which is my extremely funny way of saying that a new Warhammer 40,000 game may be forthcoming at this year's Geoffening, aka The Game Awards, which you can stream here. Specifically, a new Total War: Warhammer 40,000 game.

We know from Creative Assembly's 25th series anniversary showcase last week that they'll be announcing a sizeable new thing at the annual Keighley Hootenanny. During that previous anniversary showcase, there was also some footage of the developers' new Warcore game development tech, including a shot of a stone house with some filenames next to it. Amongst those filenames redditor Knavbot has found the magic words "40K". See below, via Ian Games.

  • 40k_outfield_sheet_01_base_colour
  • 40k_outfield_sheet_01_material_map
  • 40k_outfield_sheet_01_normal

The spoilsports among you are hastening to point out that "40K" could refer to something else. Perhaps Creative Assembly have invented the first 40K resolution videogame, for example. Perhaps you will need a dedicated fusion reactor to operate your next gaming PC.

Detractors may also comment that while it's been rumoured for yonks that Total War is heading to the grim darkness of the far future, there's a parallel rumour which suggests that the next major instalment of the strategy series will take place a long time ago in a galaxy far far away. Back in May last year, a Dualshockers report spoke of a Total War Star Wars game, much to Nic's (RPS in peace) dismay.

"Why not both?" ask the terrible, eternally hungry people for whom nothing is ever Total enough. "After all, that Dualshockers report mentions three currently in development Total War games, and we already know about Total War: Medieval 3." Sure! Why not make them all 40K resolution games while you're at it. Why not literally remove the eyelids of every Total War artist. Why not stitch them together into a human centipede that exists only to output scintillating high-def images of falling sand grains on Tatooine.

For me, the choice of licensed adaptations comes down to which game title I'll have the most fun abbreviating. I quite like "Star Twar", but "TwartyK" is just, so excellent. Might retire now, tbh. Still, you can probably do better. You can also tell me whether you think Creative Assembly have the chops to make a strategy game that's as ranged combat and vehicle-heavy as a Warhammer 40K or Star Wars game would need to be. Also: space battles?!

item.title: Meta Ray-Ban (Gen 1) Gets Cleared Out for Less Than Regular Sunglasses, Even Though They‚Äôre Smart AI Glasses
item.content:encoded:
The iconic Ray-Ban Wayfarer glasses have been cool all the way back to Buddy Holly and Roy Orbison in the ‚Äô50s, and now 7 decades later, they‚Äôre getting a whole new life as advanced tech wearables thanks to Meta. These retro-cool glasses are now 21st Century marvels with speakers, camera, mic, and Meta AI all discreetly built in, and they‚Äôre also a great limited-time deal at Amazon right now for just $224.

There are 10 different models of the Gen 1 Ray-Ban Meta Wayfarers available as part of this limited-time deal, in regular and large sizes for men and women, with a variety of frame colors and lenses ranging from clear to transitions to different shades and colors of sunglasses. They‚Äôre the top-selling AI glasses in the world, and now you can find out why for $75 less.

See at Amazon

Big Tech, But With Style

Futuristic tech mixed with impeccable classic style is the mashup we need right now, so seeing Meta team up with Ray-Ban rather than create some bizarre-looking goggles or helmet or other such thing is a hugely welcome development. The Ray-Ban Meta Wayfarers looks like the regular Wayfarers made legendary by Jack Nicholson, Tom Cruise in Risky Business, and the Blues Brothers, but these also take seriously good 12MP photos and 1080p video, which is probably why Popular Mechanics calls them the best AI glasses for social media. To engage the camera, just touch a button on the glasses‚Äô arm, or use a voice command.

(Side note: While the Wayfarers spiked again in popularity when The Blues Brothers came out in 1980, there‚Äôs an ongoing debate about whether they both wore Wayfarers, or if Dan Aykroyd‚Äôs Elwood actually wore lookalike vintage sunglasses. Either way, they‚Äôre indelibly associated with the Wayfarers.)

The Meta AI features are probably the most mindblowing of all. The multimodal AI can translate signs, identify objects, and even look up and give you historical information on something you‚Äôre looking at, in real time. It‚Äôs all done discreetly ‚Äî you gain all of the information while to the rest of the world, you‚Äôre just a person in Wayfarers. Real-time audio translations from 6 languages and counting are built in, with no Wi-Fi connection necessary.

Outstanding Audio

Even without any actual in-ear extension, the custom-built open-ear speakers sound amazing during calls or if you‚Äôre listening to music or a podcast. You get immersive sound that doesn‚Äôt intrude on the people standing near you, and you can call and text hands-free. The incredible amount of interactivity provided by the Ray-Ban Meta Wayfarers make them a content creator‚Äôs dream, a multitasker‚Äôs must-have, and they just look cool no matter which feature you‚Äôre using (or none.)

The opportunity to look like James Dean but have hidden tech worthy of James Bond is worth a heck of lot more than just $224, but that‚Äôs the Amazon price tag on the Ray-Ban Meta Wayfarers during this limited-time deal. Save 25% and grab one of the best and coolest tech wearables available anywhere. 

See at Amazon

item.title: Helldivers 2 X Killzone Returns As A Legendary Warbond
item.content:encoded:
PlayStation have announced that Killzone content is returning to Helldivers 2, and this time, it‚Äôs here to stay.

Back in December 2024, Killzone made its first appearance in Helldivers 2 with two waves of crossover items that included weapons, armor sets, and cosmetics. The developers at Arrowhead have made it clear that they‚Äôve heard the fan feedback regarding the pricing and that the content will instead be re-released as a Premium Warbond.

Killzone-Themed Premium Warbond Heading To Helldivers 2

Announced via the PlayStation Blog, Arrowhead have confirmed that a fresh batch of Killzone-themed gear is on the way to Helldivers 2. For 1500 Super Credits, players will be able to unlock a Premium Warbond packed with iconic Killzone weapons, armor, and cosmetics‚Äîplus a collection of brand-new items that weren‚Äôt part of last year‚Äôs limited release.

Better still, Arrowhead are rewarding returning players. Anyone who previously purchased any Killzone item‚Äîeven a single piece‚Äîwill receive the full Killzone Legendary Warbond at no extra cost. All previously owned or gifted items will also be medal-unlocked, meaning players won‚Äôt need to spend medals to reclaim them and can instead focus on the new additions.

Here‚Äôs how eligibility works, as confirmed by PlayStation.

  • Players who have previously purchased any (even one) of the Killzone items, will have the whole Helldivers 2 x Killzone Legendary Warbond unlocked at no extra cost! Additionally, there is no medal vacuum here! The items previously purchased (and those which were gifted last December) will be medal unlocked. So no need to spend medals on the items you already own!
  • Players who received the gifted items in December 2024 but didn‚Äôt pay for any single item, will have to pay the 1500 Super Credits to unlock the full Legendary Warbond. 
  • Not to worry, if you do pay for the Warbond; the gifted items will also be medal unlocked.
  • Players joining after the Helldivers 2 x Killzone items left the store in December 2024 can access the Warbond by unlocking it for 1500 SC, and then enjoy redeeming medals on their favorite items just as usual.

The Premium Warbond includes every item from the first two waves of Killzone X Helldivers 2 content, as well as a list of new items, including:

  • StA-52 Assault Rifle
  • StA-11 SMG
  • PLAS-39 Accelerator rifle
  • AC-1 Dutiful/The Strength In Our Arms cape
  • AC-2 Obedient/Defender of Our Dream cape
  • Acclimated Passive
  • Extrasolar Ash patterns

If you‚Äôre a fan of either franchise, then now‚Äôs a great time to hop back into Helldivers 2. Will you be checking out the new Premium Warbond? Share your thoughts in the official Insider Gaming Discord.

item.title: Cyberpunk 2077 Writer Confirms Long-Held Fan Theory
item.content:encoded:
Cyberpunk 2077‚Äôs lead writer has stated that the team understood during the game‚Äôs pre-production that Night City would be the main antagonist, confirming the age-old fan theory.

The main attraction of Cyberpunk 2077 has always been Night City, which is not only a dense open-world that will keep you engaged the entire journey, but also an all-knowing and all-seeing entity that sells people big dreams, but they always come with massive repercussions. Now, a lead writer has confirmed that Night City is indeed the true villain of Cyberpunk 2077.

It‚Äôs Always ‚ÄòNight City Versus Everyone Else‚Äô in Cyberpunk 2077

For some time, players have theorised that Night City is the main character and antagonist in Cyberpunk 2077, and this post on r/cyberpunkgame explains it quite well. During an interview with GamesRadar+, Cyberpunk 2077‚Äôs lead writer, Tomasz Marchewka, confirmed, ‚ÄúQuite quickly, during pre-production of Cyberpunk 2077, we realized that Night City is going to be our main antagonist.‚Äù

Marchewka acknowledged that some players had caught on quite quickly and asked about it. The game also features other antagonists, such as Arasaka, Adam Smasher, and others. However, it has always been ‚ÄúNight City versus everyone else, even the big guys. So yeah, that‚Äôs a cool concept to make the city the main antagonist,‚Äù explained the lead writer.

Igor Sarzynski, the cinematic director, also explained why players might find this world so compelling, stating that for him it was always finding the balance between ‚Äúsubtle, personal, human, and emotional elements ‚Äì things that are fragile and touching and invite compassion ‚Äì versus what you mention: the danger, the violence.‚Äù

‚ÄúEverything that forces you to put on armor, literal or emotional, and protect yourself, fight for survival. Night City exists right on the edge of those realms, between beauty and bloodshed, and so you‚Äôre never bored; you always think that maybe the next dream will come true,‚Äù Sarzynski added.

In other news, the Cyberpunk 2077 sequel will feature a city that feels like ‚ÄòChicago Gone Wrong‚Äò. Additionally, CD Projekt Red and WierdCo have announced Cyberpunk TCG. Did you think that Night City was the main antagonist in Cyberpunk 2077? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Helldivers 2 developers working on a rogue-lite mode. Don‚Äôt forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Wah! A New GameCube Game Just Surprise-Released On Switch 2
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Maybe as a holiday treat, Nintendo has added a new GameCube title for Nintendo Switch Online + Expansion Pack subscribers out of the blue. Wario World is now playable for the service on Switch 2.

Originally released in 2003, Wario World is a 3D platformer that sees the antihero looking for payback after his treasure is stolen and his castle destroyed. Coincidentally, Treasure is the developer behind the GameCube title. The studio is known for Gunstar Heroes, Sin and Punishment, and Ikaruga.

Wario World brings the GameCube library up to seven titles on Switch 2 for the Expansion Pack tier. What's intriguing about Wario World is that Nintendo has teased GameCube titles that still aren't out on the service, such as Fire Emblem: Path of Radiance and Pokemon Colosseum. Meanwhile, Wario World hadn't previously been mentioned. Luigi's Mansion arrived on the subscription service right before Halloween and was the last addition.

Earlier this week, Nintendo announced that Rayman 2: The Great Escape and Tonic Trouble will come to the Nintendo 64 library for the Expansion Pack tier on December 17. A Nintendo Switch Online membership costs $20 annually and includes NES, SNES, and Game Boy catalogs. For Wario World and Rayman 2, the Expansion Pack tier is required, costing $50 yearly (and $80 for a family plan). However, just to note, only Switch 2 owners have access to the GameCube library.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: IO Interactive Spoils Its Own Surprise, Leaks 007 First Light Villain Ahead of The Game Awards 2025
item.content:encoded:
We are mere hours away from The Game Awards 2025, and just like in previous years, that means there are at least a couple of announcements that have been spoiled right down to the wire. This year, it's IO Interactive accidentally posted a reveal that was almost certainly planned for tonight's show, with a new trailer showcasing one key, but until now, an absent part of 007 First Light - and any major James Bond story - the villain.

The initial post shared by the official 007 First Light X (formerly Twitter) was quickly taken down, though not before users on ResetEra were able to capture it and share it far and wide across the internet. Which is how we now know that Bawma, the villain in the James Bond coming-of-agent story in 007 First Light, is played by none other than Lenny Kravitz.

It's unfortunate for IO Interactive that what would have been a pretty solid reveal was shared early accidentally, and surely some poor intern or social media manager at IO Interactive is not having the best day. That said, the early reveal doesn't take away from the fact that 007 First Light appears to be shaping up to be a classic Bond story, through-and-through.

All the way down to Bond being dangled over a pool of some kind of carnivorous animal that the villain keeps as pets. You don't get more Bond than that, and at this point, it seems like all the game's story might be missing is a front shot of James or his love interest (or both) slowly rising from the water after a swim in the ocean and walking onto the beach.

For more on The Game Awards ahead of tonight's show, you can check out the full list of nominees here, which includes 007 First Light and its nomination for 'Most Anticipated Game.' Not that it'll win next to Grand Theft Auto VI, but it has a nomination all the same. You can also check out a list of every announcement that's been rumoured and/or confirmed to appear at tonight's show, and all Game Awards information you might need at our full Game Awards hub, here.

Follow Wccftech on Google to get more of our news coverage in your feeds.

You won‚Äôt have to rely on the keypad or the mouse to find your way around things; just use your fingers directly on the screen to pinch, tap, scroll, draw, and even type. Paired with the screen is a spacious, full-sized backlit keyboard. It makes typing long documents easy on the wrists, while the backlight lets you hit goals even after the shadows fall.

The laptop runs on the AMD Ryzen 5 7430U 6-core processor, which is capable of hitting speeds up to 4.3GHz. The 1TB SSD lets you store all your important files in a single place. You can throw in a ton of videos, high-resolution photos, work documents, research files, and more with ease. Even better, the memory and storage are expandable up to 64GB RAM and 2TB SSD, respectively, so you can always add more as your needs grow in the future.

Battery life is just as solid. A single charge gets you up to 9 hours of video playback, meaning you can go a full day without plugging it in. item.title: The Villain In 007 First Light May Be Played By Someone Totally Unexpected
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Ahead of The Game Awards, a trailer for the new James Bond game 007: First Light has leaked, revealing what appears to be the game's main villain and the actor playing him. The character is reportedly named Bawma and he will be played by Lenny Kravitz, according to the trailer leak.

Kravitz is best known for his success in music, but he does have acting experience as well, appearing in The Hunger Games movies as Cinna. He also acts in his many music videos.

Now Playing: 007 First Light ‚Äì Official 34 Minute Gameplay Reveal | Sony State of Play

Actor Patrick Gibson plays a young James Bond in First Light, which tells a new, original story of how Bond became 007. The game's cast also includes No Time To Die actor Priyanga Burford as M, The Walking Dead's Lennie James as Greenway, Death in Paradise's Kiera Lester as Miss Moneypenny, and Andor actor Alastair Mackenzie as Q.

Additionally, Marvel actor Gemma Chan plays Dr. Selina Tan and Noemie Nakai (Tokyo Vice) portrays Miss Roth.

First Light is set for releases on March 26, 2026 for PS5, Xbox Series X|S, Switch 2, and PC. It's being developed by Hitman studio IO Interactive, which is also making a fantasy game.

If the trailer was meant to be shown at The Game Awards, people won't have much longer to wait to see it, as the show takes place today, December 11. For more, check out GameSpot's rundown of how to watch and what to expect from The Game Awards.
